reviewText:
Early Access Review

OreLight has great potential and, after a short adjustment period, can be very enjoyable. It's still work in progress so there's more content to be added and tweaks to be made, but even so, there's plenty to craft, several environments to explore, and huge dungeons to fight in.

Almost everything you craft you can take with you if you move camp, there are several resources to mine, and food to grow, and there's a good variety of enemies.

For a good time be sure to make the cannon and place it in a dungeon.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KR40hzn49G4

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Do not be fooled by the sweet talk of what the game is expected to become. Right now this game is EL POOP ,at best, right now.

The dev team barely keeps up with the few players that bought their game and take more than 1 month to post a non-update announcement on the forums.

Low amount of in-game options, awkward combat, VERY limited gallery of fighting actions ( spells, pets, talents ) buggy menu, buggy AND lagged multiplayer.
There are so many games that are better than this piece of crap and for half or less of the price.

I bought this game with a 33% discount coupon and I still regret it EVERY DAY, it wouldn't be worth it even if for only 5€.

No idea how I put up with it for 9 hours, well actually I do, my refund was not accepted.

Please think of the kittens and have a nice day.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is my first review for a game, so here it goes:

For being an early access game, it's actually pretty fun and the overall aesthetic is very pleasant. It takes a little while to get used to, but the interface actually feels really good and the chat felt very natural. I teamed up with a bunch of other newbies and it was really easy to coordinate our actions using the chat function, and I typically avoid that in most games because it takes away from the gameplay a lot of the time. The crafting is very much like minecraft, and I should warn you that you have to click and hold the left mouse button to absorb" materials. Absorbing works very much like minecraft's mining function
date: and you can pretty much absorb anything.\n\nMy biggest fear for this game stems from the fact that if you're on a public server
recommended: you can't really defend your stuff or level up or anything
hoursPlayed: so it takes a bit too much from Minecraft's book if you ask me. Dungeon crawlers and adventure games should reward playing a bit more
voteText: but it seems like all of your work can disappear the next time you play (I just ended up handing all my stuff off to the people I was playing with because we were just getting used to the whole structure). I like how stealing activates PvP
helpfulPercent: but I would like for more organized ways of teaming up with other players rather than the free-for-all style it feels like now. I tried building a house with some other players and we kept accidentally activating PvP every time we tried to upgrade walls.\n\nI'll keep updating this review as I play the game to reflect how I see its progress
votesHelpful: but overall I'm happy with it and I'm excited to see where it goes. I'm a bit of a serial game returner
votesTotal: so it says a lot to my friends if I keep a game that seems unfinished. The developers seem committed to making the game better
votesFunny: and I really appreciate that. I'm also an aspiring developer and I can really get behind a lot of the choices they made. It feels unique
commentsCount: but they're not always trying to reinvent the wheel
column16: which gives it a nice new-but-familiar vibe.\n\nfor day 2 or whatever of its release
column17: it shows A LOT of potential. I was running it at super high framerates most of the time. Two issues I did have
column18: I tried dragging items into crates and it works
column20: and any time another player teleported to me it made my game freak out a little bit.\n\nAt this point I'll give it a solid 8/10 for it's overall vibe
column21: but I definitely see that turning into a 9 or 10 if they keep making it better. Also
column22: it'd be nice if Iron Ore was a little more available because I kept seeing gold more than iron
column23: which seemed a little silly to me."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm pretty upset with myself for purchasing this game.  While it was fun at first, and had lots of potential, the dev seems to have abandoned the game altogether.  No updates have been pushed in nearly 4 months, and nobody's heard anything from the dev.

Kind of shameful if you ask me.  I wish I could get my money back still.  Do not purchase.  If you do, you'll be buying a game that's fun for about 5 hours and far from a finished product.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Good game definately has potential decent gameplay things will be reworked/tweaked as many other titles out there.

Pro's
------
Hack/Slash dungeon crawler rpg
You are what you are what you wear no skills atleast i dont think yet.
Base building destructible world traps,cannons,etc..
Multiplayer but only up to 12 people per server as of right now im sure as the game grows its community the server limit will be higher
Pvp pretty fun hack and slash melee combat
Crafting pretty decent different unique items for different roles in playing in game.

Con's
------
You have to enable pvp and your oppenet has to have pvp enabled in order to deal damage to eachother
A bit sluggish atm on the animations working sometimes not a deal breaker :D
Server has somewhat of a timelapse syncing issue atm i think i get drawed back to different spot then where i wanted to be its like a rubberband effect.


So far i rate this game 7.5/10

Things i would liked to see worked on.
------------------------------------
Pvp-Maybe remove the pvp Enabler and have open world pvp, or certain areas of land and dungeons can be hostile and everyone is attackable inside these Hotspots.
Also i would like to see server limit go to about 30-50+ maybe less servers more capacity in each server more populated servers are always funner atleast for most gamers.
More Classes Orcs,Humans,Elves,Giants
Maybe a grouping system
Bosses?
Rares or unique items?

reviewText:
Early Access Review

this game is incredibly addicting. get your friends with you and you will multiply your enjoyment by monstrous amounts. while still  being in ealry access it provides many things to do so you dont waste your money on buying a game with no playability.

Pros
-many of things to craft
-dungeons
-huge map
-pvp toggling
-dedicated servers
-no lag (dependant on the server you join)
-exploring is easy
-sandbox

Cons
-occasional lag spikes
-lonely (no one is on regularly)
-Not fully developed  (although still in early access)
-no spawn points
-anyone can take your things
-no intel to collect items you need (eg. i didn't know how to get obsidian for about 8 hrs)
-small amount of mobs
-no mining sounds

overall, it is a game to play if you dont mind the occasional lag and not being to spawn at your home (most annoying thing EVER) i would recommend it to anywhere that likes any sandbox/survival games :D

reviewText:
Early Access Review

What you will do:You will start a singleplayer game because all servers are empty
You will mine some gold ore
You will get annoyed by the mining sounds and disable them
You will explore the world and find a dungeon
You will find treasure chests in this dungeon
You will notice that all treasure chests are empty
You will fight skeleton archers
You will die because they use aim bot
You will find a large field of carrots
You will notice that you can't eat raw carrots
You will die of starvation
You will fight skeletons
You will notice that they can't hit you if you walk backwards while attacking
You will need a lot of iron for armor and weapons
You will find more gold ore than coal, and more coal than iron ore
You will finally find iron ore and craft a badass armor
You will fight skeletons
You will explore some more
You will meet an old man and kill him in his own house
You will find a really big dungeon
You will fight a boss enemy there
You will only get a scrap of cloth for defeating him
You will not be able to see John Cena
You will play 5 more hours to get the trading cards
You will uninstall this game
You will play Morrowind again and have fun

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Orelight is that relaxing game you want to play, when you want to build, farm, craft, hunt or pvp in multiplayer agens other people. The games offer a uniqe interface and design, where you are getting interested really quickly in what you can craft and build.

The game is beautiful and makes you wonder what's hidden around in the huge map we are in. The game also offers local / singleplayer and a multiplayer online for those who want to play with others.

Overall you need to hunt for food so you don't die, since you have a hunger to take care off. I haven't seen any potions so far for health (which is regenerating slowly).

The crafting system has many different kind of items to craft. Traps, chairs, spiketrap, different kind of floor marterial, weapons which is bows, swords etc. You can make a workbench which is needed to craft advanced items. Aswell for melting ore's. If you find different kind of food, you can harvest it.

Home design is great, and the astmotphere wants you to stay late, even you need to go work. Even i am sitting right now with a funny feeling in my stomach saying: Move on.. do it.. It's calling." You can collect all items in the Orelight world as far as i'm aware.

After finding sultions for playing the game with a smile on my face
date: i can recommend this game for people who wants something different than the usual crafting-survival
recommended: concept of dungeon-crawling with basebuilding multiplayer game.\n\nIf you think this is not enough to make you support the devs or the game
hoursPlayed: i would recommend watching what i've experienced to get a better feel for the game: http://www.twitch.tv/theearlyaccess/v/6737093"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

ABSORB ALL THE THINGS!!

I haven't played this kind of game before and at first I thought the controls would be tricky, but I've got used to them already and I'm loving it! I liked having my sidekick Sven around at the start and I even made up a little backstory for him so I was sorry when he went!

I love that the game can pretty much go at your own pace. You can choose to quietly explore, absorb EVERYTHING with no idea what you're going to do with it and then improvise your creations later, or you can go in and slash some skeletons and folk to bits — whatever mood you're in!

Looking forward to playing more Orelight and finding out what else I can do with it because I feel like there's a lot more to it and it has potential to get really addictive!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

OreLight combines the freedom of a crafting sandbox with the thrill of an action-RPG. You are thrust into not one, but seven hostile worlds, repleat with treacherous lava, wide open fields and hidden dungeons. Gather resources to build a homestead and defend it against the game's not-so-friendly elements. Craft weapons, armor and special items to give yourslef a fighting chance. Whether you go it alone, or team up with friends...this early access experience is sure to build upon itself during the coming months!

Check out my full review and forum, too:

Haven Review: OreLight[gamers-haven.org]
Heroes of Gamers Haven:  Forum[www.gamers-haven.org]

reviewText:
Early Access Review

OreLight is an upcoming hack and slash with resource gathering and base building features. While it is currently in a rudimentary state, so far the developers have put together a solid foundation to work from.

If you're expecting a $20 (or $16.99) gaming experience, I'd advise you to be patient. The game is in Early Access for a reason: it is not finished.

The fighting is rudimentary at best (a set of swords, a set of bows, mindless clicking, no skills or abilities). Mining and harvesting is currently just right clicking on objects and waiting. Base building has a bit more content going for it, with the ability to build your own little abode based on crafted items or items pilfered from neighbouring inhabited and uninhabited dwellings.

In closing, OreLight looks truly promising. That said, there is still a lot of work ahead for the developers, so if you feel like trusting them I'd recommend going ahead purchasing a copy. Just consider it an investment for a game that will be finished in the future. Otherwise, you'll just be setting yourself up for disappointment, and no one wants to be disappointed, right?

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've been playing OreLight off and on since March of 2015 (prior to its Steam Greenlight) so I would guess I have an additional hour or two of gameplay under my belt compared to what Steam shows. (Full disclosure, I was given a copy of the game from the developers... but you probably figured that out because it available in March)

This game shows a lot of promise. It's clearly still a work in progress, but what I see and play so far is quite enjoyable. It has a beautiful graphical style and amazing lighting/shadow effects. The gameplay/controls have their quirks, but it's overall very solid.

The game doesn't take itself too seriously, and I like that.

The skeletons are derpy and the light dialog here and there can be enjoyable. The enemies will yell Adventurer!" and "Kill him!" when they see you
date: but every once in a while you'll see something funny. In the video linked below I captured a particularly funny moment about 15 minutes in where a skeleton says
recommended: "The wife keeps moaning about how I've never killed an Adventurer." I like that
hoursPlayed:
and I expect more of it to be added.

Another funny moment for me was the realization that I have to use an anvil to make mashed potatoes. It's little things like that that I enjoy about this game. Also the fact that mashed potatoes is an item.

I do have minor gripes about the game (Mainly the collection of resources. It doesn't always try to collect the item I'm clicking on) but I don't intend to mention them because this is in early access and minor gripes are to be expected. I just want to affirm that the game shows a lot of promise. It is in early access. It is fun.

Here's a link to the previously mentioned video. This is gameplay of when I found my first dungeon while exploring. It also involves me running back to my house to get better equipped because I almost died at first.
http://youtu.be/KGpT_aZt4Ss"
